trans-unit.source: Represents an expression used as a method invoke parameter along with a reference direction indicator.
<xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression> can represent a parameter passed to a method and the reference direction of the parameter.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression.Expression%2A> property indicates the expression to qualify with a direction.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression.Direction%2A> property indicates the direction of the parameter using one of the <xref:System.CodeDom.FieldDirection> enumeration values.
<xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression> is intended to be used as a method invoke parameter, and should not be used when declaring methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeDirectionExpression"></xref> class using the specified field direction and expression.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.FieldDirection"></xref> that indicates the field direction of the expression.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the code expression to represent.
Gets or sets the field direction for this direction expression.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.FieldDirection"></xref> that indicates the field direction for this direction expression.
Gets or sets the code expression to represent.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the expression to represent.
